chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Roller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
If the Defendant's Probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall be the same as the conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine plus costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-----------------------------------

No contact with the victims, James and Peggy Ames without the Agent's and victims' consent.  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No driving without a valid license.
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before September 4, 2015 @ 8:00 am. The Defendant may serve his conditional release jail time in Rock County, and may be served under electronic monitoring if available to him.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven J Roller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Order to Produce filed with Court.
Reminder Notice returned via mail - unable to forward
Temporary Commitment form - confining defendant to the Walworth Jail until March 27, 2017

3:32 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Defendant Steven J Roller in court, in custody.   Probation Agent Art Coleman appeared for the Dept. of Corrections.  This has been scheduled at the request of Agent Coleman for a court review.  Agent Coleman makes record that it had become evident that Mr. Roller was not living at the address he listed.  There was discussion about trying to get him a stable residence.  The prior agent had the same problem.  Back in first part of February he had a scheduled appointment and said he was in school and not able to make it.  He was to report the following week with his full class schedule and student ID.  He has no information as to his classes.  Defendant was lying and failing to comply with conditions of his supervision.  Mr. Roller would tell his Agent that he was still employed when he was not.  Defendant was eventually picked up on Dane county.  He was still in a holding cell because of suicidal threats when the Agent went to pick him up.  The jail social worker determined that he was not a threat to himself.  DOC is asking for 30 to 60 days in Jail to impress upon him to need to be compliant with his behavior and authority figures.  He was placed in custody on February 15th.  The Dept. does not intend to proceed with a revocation at this time.  3:40 pm  Statement by Mr. Roller that he does not feel that it is necessary for him to be incarceration.  He indicates he has learning disability, anxiety, depression and bipolar.  Agent Coleman states that has not been verified.  Defendant says he has a counselor, Sue,  (Beloit Counseling Center), and a CCS worker through Rock County and a pill provider, Kate, at Beloit Counseling Center.  He says he takes a lot of medications that he takes.  He says he is getting them in the jail and he had not been remembering to take the drugs.  He was living with his ex-girlfriend.  Court admonishes defendant that it is an order of the Court that he must comply with rules and orders of probation which includes telling them where he is living.  He is willing to do that.  Defendant admits that he lied to his Agent about going to school.  He does not have his G.E.D.  He currently gets SSI check so he believes he can only work up to 25 hours per week.  He admits to lying to Agent when he told him that he was still working.  Court admonishes deft that his attitude is incredibly poor.  Defendant says that he is now taking his medications, and he realizes he has to take them.  Agent is hoping defendant can make a few positive choices.  Defendant will speak with his mother to see if she will let him live there.  He was sleeping on a couch at his girlfriend's house, not paying rent and was saying he was helping taking care of her son - and defendant can't take care of himself at the moment.  Defendant's mother lives in Janesville.  The first thing he will do when he gets out is to make sure he has his medication lined up.  Agent is hoping Mr. Roller will get in contact with his Mother so she can assist in getting appointments with his counselor / doctor in order get the medications that he needs.  Court makes record with regard to the nurse practitioner that we have in the jail who might be able to help him with his medications.  Court Orders defendant be held in jail until March 27, 2017.  Immediately upon release from jail he is to report to his Probation Agent in Janesville.  He must comply with Agent in terms of where he will be living -- it needs to be a stable residence.   4:00 pm  Court in recess.
E-mails re:  scheduling of Court Review hearing at request of Probation Agent

Defendant Steven J Roller in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Steven J Roller in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Signed bond filed with the court.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven J Roller
Current: 710 McKinley Street, Janesville, WI 53548 United States  (Effective: 03-06-2015)
Prior: 1618 Gartland Ave, Janesville, WI 53548

TOTAL BOND COVERS 15CF78 AND 15CT41
Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH JAMES AND PEGGY AMES. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Steven J Roller in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Defendant Steven J Roller not in court.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant to issue.  Minutes filed.
